greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = tau(n) + omega(n).
comment: Here tau(n)=the number of divisors of n=A000005(n) and omega(n)=the number distinct primes dividing n=A001221(n).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: A001221 := proc(n) nops(numtheory[factorset](n)) ; end: A163523 := proc(n) numtheory[tau](n)+A001221(n) ; end: seq(A163523(n),n=1..120) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 01 2009
program: (PARI) for(n=1,50, print1(numdiv(n) + omega(n), ", ")) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, May 16 2017
results.author: _Juri-Stepan Gerasimov_, Jul 30 2009
ext: a(40) and a(49) corrected by _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 01 2009
